document_data.name: A Song of Elturel
document_data.mainbody: '''''A Song of Elturel''''' was a ballad about the city of [[Elturel]] in the latter part of the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].<ref group="note">The title of the song is unknown, so ''A Song of Elturel'' is taken from the first line. It is unclear if this is meant to be an existing song or if it was invented by the spirit of the Elfsong Tavern in 1494 DR.
document_data.Contents:
{{quote|''O sing a song of Elturel
Of water, woods, and hill
The sun dawns on her ruddy cliffs
And fields green and still.
This land of long-abiding joy
Home of the strong and brave
Renowned by all, across the realms,
And never once a slave.

O sing a song of Elturel
When foes are at her door
Her fields torn by cloven feet
From some infernal shore.
Arise the mighty [[Hellriders]]
Take up your swift, keen swords
Then charge into the hellish fray
And scatter devil hordes.

O sing a song of Elturel
And when the night does fall
Sleep safe beneath [[The Companion|Companion's]] light
Until the dawn does call.
We're bound by [[Creed Resolute|mortal covenant]]
That only ends with death
And so we'll sing of Elturel
Until our final breath.''|Translated from [[Elvish]]}}
document_data.History: It was sung in Elvish by the ghostly [[elf]] spirit of the [[Elfsong Tavern]] in [[Baldur's Gate]] in the {{YearlinkName|1492}}{{BG-DiA-time}}, after the descent of Elturel into [[Avernus]]. Notably, this was the only time it was heard to change its tune.
